turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2010 Oklahoma Sooners football team.
turn.1: What was the 2010 Sooners football team's season like?
turn.2: 2010 Oklahoma Sooners football team The 2010 Oklahoma Sooners football team represented the University of Oklahoma in the 2010 NCAA Division I FBS football season, the 116th season of Sooner football.
turn.4: The team was led by two-time Walter Camp Coach of the Year Award winner, Bob Stoops, in his 12th season as head coach.
turn.6: They played their home games at Gaylord Family Oklahoma Memorial Stadium in Norman, Oklahoma.
turn.8: They were a charter member of the Big 12 Conference.
turn.10: Conference play began with a win in the annual Red River Rivalry over the Texas Longhorns on October 2, and concluded with a win over the Nebraska Cornhuskers in the Big 12 Championship Game on December 4.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: The Sooners finished the regular season with an 11–2 record (6–2 in Big 12) while winning their seventh Big 12 title and their 43rd conference title overall.
